pr_data.title: fix: fiddle ipc code pattern 3
pr_data.body:
#### Description of Change
Closes #32867 
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
Fixed docs and fiddle code and tested with the fiddle.
- Added missing requirement `ipcMain` in docs code.
- Modified `event.reply` to `event.sender.send` as reply is not a function anymore in process event.

#### Checklist
<!-- Remove items that do not apply. For completed items, change [ ] to [x]. -->

- [X] `npm test` passes
- [X] relevant documentation is changed or added

#### Release Notes
Notes: none

pr_data.title: docs: added upstream doc links for node, chromium, and v8 in default_app
pr_data.body:
#### Description of Change

Added upstream documentation links for Node.js, Chromium, and V8 in the default_app of Electron.

Fixes #14728

This is my first open-source contribution, and I’m excited to get involved with Electron! I would appreciate any feedback on improvements or best practices.

#### Checklist
<!-- Remove items that do not apply. For completed items, change [ ] to [x]. -->

- [x] PR description included and stakeholders cc'd
- [x] `npm test` passes
- [ ] tests are [changed or added](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/docs/development/testing.md)
- [x] relevant documentation, tutorials, templates and examples are changed or added
- [x] [PR release notes](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/main/README.md) describe the change in a way relevant to app developers, and are [capitalized, punctuated, and past tense](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/main/README.md#examples).

#### Release Notes

Notes: Added upstream documentation links for Node.js, Chromium, and V8 in the default_app.

pr_data.title: Improve Documentation on Handling Deep Links on Cold Start (Windows &…
pr_data.body:
# Improve Deep Linking Documentation for Cold Start Scenarios  #42627

## Problem
The current Electron documentation lacks clear guidance on handling deep links during cold start (when the app is not running), particularly for Windows and Linux platforms. This creates confusion for developers implementing deep linking across different platforms.

## Solution
I've enhanced the deep linking documentation with:

1. **New Comprehensive Guide** (`docs/tutorial/deep-linking.md`)
   ```diff
   + Created new deep-linking.md with platform-specific implementation details
   + Added clear examples for cold start handling
   + Included best practices and error handling patterns
   ```

2. **Updated Quick Start Guide** (`docs/tutorial/launch-app-from-url-in-another-app.md`)
   ```diff
   - <!-- ✍ Update this section if you want to provide more details -->
   + Added platform-specific notes for cold start behavior
   + Added reference to comprehensive deep linking guide
   ```

3. **Enhanced API Docs** (`docs/api/app.md`)
   ```diff
   - Sets the current executable as the default handler for a protocol...
   + Added detailed platform-specific behavior documentation
   + Added development vs production setup examples
   + Added cold start handling instructions
   ```

## Key Improvements

### 1. Clear Platform Differences
Before developers had to figure out platform differences through trial and error. Now it's explicitly documented:
```javascript
// Windows & Linux (cold start)
app.on('ready', () => {
  const deepLinkUrl = process.argv.find(arg => arg.startsWith('myapp://'))
  if (deepLinkUrl) handleDeepLink(deepLinkUrl)
})

// macOS (all scenarios)
app.on('will-finish-launching', () => {
  app.on('open-url', (event, url) => {
    event.preventDefault()
    handleDeepLink(url)
  })
})
```

### 2. Development Environment Support
Added clear guidance for development scenarios:
```javascript
if (process.defaultApp) {
  if (process.argv.length >= 2) {
    app.setAsDefaultProtocolClient('myapp', process.execPath, [path.resolve(process.argv[1])])
  }
} else {
  app.setAsDefaultProtocolClient('myapp')
}
```

### 3. Best Practices
Added practical examples for robust implementations:
```javascript
function isValidDeepLink(url) {
  try {
    const parsedUrl = new URL(url)
    return parsedUrl.protocol === 'myapp:'
  } catch {
    return false
  }
}
```

## Before & After

Before:
- No clear guidance on cold start handling
- Platform differences buried in implementation details
- Development vs production setup unclear

After:
- Clear platform-specific implementation guides
- Step-by-step cold start handling instructions
- Best practices and error handling patterns
- Development environment configuration examples

## Testing
- Verified documentation accuracy on Windows, Linux, and macOS
- Validated code examples in both development and production
- Confirmed cross-references between all documentation files

## Related
Closes #40173

# Improve Deep Linking Documentation for Cold Start Scenarios  #42627

## Problem
The current Electron documentation lacks clear guidance on handling deep links during cold start (when the app is not running), particularly for Windows and Linux platforms. This creates confusion for developers implementing deep linking across different platforms.

pr_data.title: docs: fix deep linking documentation to address platform-specific issues
pr_data.body:
This PR improves the deep linking documentation to address several important issues that were previously undocumented:

1. macOS Synchronous Handling: Added critical guidance on registering the 'open-url' event listener synchronously at application startup to prevent missed events.

2. Windows/Linux Cold Start: Added missing documentation for handling deep links when the application is launched from a cold start on Windows and Linux platforms using process.argv.

3. Protocol Registration Explanation: Added clear explanations for the different protocol registration approaches between development and production environments.

These changes provide comprehensive guidance for implementing deep linking correctly across all platforms and scenarios, ensuring developers can properly implement this feature in their Electron applications.

Fixes #40173
pr_data.body_cleaned:
This PR improves the deep linking documentation to address several important issues that were previously undocumented:

1. macOS Synchronous Handling: Added critical guidance on registering the 'open-url' event listener synchronously at application startup to prevent missed events.

2. Windows/Linux Cold Start: Added missing documentation for handling deep links when the application is launched from a cold start on Windows and Linux platforms using process.argv.

3. Protocol Registration Explanation: Added clear explanations for the different protocol registration approaches between development and production environments.

These changes provide comprehensive guidance for implementing deep linking correctly across all platforms and scenarios, ensuring developers can properly implement this feature in their Electron applications.

Fixes #40173
